maturation_criteria.timing: Assess at 4-6 weeks, use at 6 weeks to 3 months

physical_exam.augmentation: Visible vein enlargement with exercise/dependent arm

learning_objectives: Apply the Rule of 6s to assess fistula maturation
Perform physical examination of AV fistula
Identify failure to mature and intervention options
clinical_pearls: The Rule of 6s: Flow >600, Diameter >6mm, Depth <6mm
Assess at 4-6 weeks to allow early salvage of failing fistulas
Failure to mature occurs in 20-60% - early intervention is key
Physical exam: Thrill at anastomosis, soft compressible body, visible outflow vein
If flow <500 mL/min at 4 weeks, fistulogram and intervention indicated
Juxta-anastomotic stenosis is the most common cause of failure to mature
